full_bio: A proud Austin native and UT graduate, Dr. Ho brings warmth, precision, and a family-first approach to every smile he cares for at Cedar Park Dental & Braces. When he’s not cheering on the Texas Longhorns, exploring new cuisines, or hunting for the softest blanket in the store, you’ll find him traveling, cooking, and making his daughter smile.

A San Antonio native and proud graduate of UT Health San Antonio, Dr. Muñiz brings contagious energy and a genuine passion for helping patients feel confident in their smiles. When she’s not creating transformations chairside, she loves hiking, practicing yoga, exploring new cuisines, and dreaming up her next travel adventure.

Dr Richards has practiced general dentistry in American Fork for more than twenty-seven years. He was born in Tucson, Arizona and raised in Salt Lake City, Utah. He graduated as the top 3 of his class at Oregon Health Sciences School of Dentistry (1992), and at University of Utah (1988). Dr Richards served a residency at University of Utah VA hospital (1992-1993) He is a long-standing member of the American Dental Association and the Provo Dental Society. Dr. Richards enjoys learning and continues to learn the newest advancements in cosmetics, Implants, full mouth restoration, veneers, and bone grafting. Dr Richards established his Dental Practice in 1993 on Center Street and then for the past twenty years has been located at 233 E Main. Dr. Richards has always enjoyed practicing in American Fork where he has seen many families grow and mature. He takes pride in his practice and cares about his patients, treating them with the attention and respect that they deserve. Outside the office Dr Richards enjoys spending time in the outdoors. He hikes, runs, bikes, swims, and rides horse. Dr Richards has learned to scuba dive, paraglide and became a private pilot. Dr Richards and several office staff have done many working trips to the Dominican Republic, serving a week to those of major needs free dental work each time.
education: Oregon Health Sciences School of Dentistry, University of Utah

full_bio: Dr. Basi grew up in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, and attended the University of Pittsburgh, where he earned a Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering in 1990 and his Doctor of Dental Medicine (D.M.D.) degree in 1994. He went on to complete his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery training at the University of Minnesota, where he also earned a Ph.D. in Oral Biology in 2002. Following his training, Dr. Basi served for nine years as an Associate Professor in the Division of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery at the University of Minnesota. His research has focused on the effects of bisphosphonates on oral wound healing, and clinically he has a special interest in complex oral reconstruction using dental implants. Dr. Basi is board certified and actively involved in organized dentistry as a member of the American Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, the Minnesota Dental Association, and the American Dental Association. He currently serves as Chair of the Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery Foundation, a national nonprofit organization dedicated to advancing the specialty through innovative research, high-quality education, and initiatives that ultimately enhance patient care and safety. Outside of his professional life, Dr. Basi enjoys raising his twin daughters, Josephine and Vivianne, born in 2011. He also has a passion for music, golf, and photography.
education: Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering, Doctor of Dental Medicine (D.M.D.), Ph.D. in Oral Biology
